args:
Having established a foothold at the ancient castle
in the Mistholt known as the Halidom, Alberius
continued to fight for a better future. I remained at
his side, supporting him more than ever. And yet...
Mym, do you have a moment?\nIt's about our next expedition.
Ah, yes. I just finished compiling the \nscouts' reports, and—oops!
Now they're all over the floor. Sorry.
I'll help you pick them up.
Sorry, I didn't mean to bump your hand.
Your breathing seems labored, too.\nAre you coming down with something?
(He's so close! I'm not sure I can bring\nmyself to look him in the eye...)
Ah, very good. Thank you for letting me\nknow, Cleo.
But of course. That's my job.\nNow, if you'll excuse me.
Hm. I see she's as distant as ever.
That was Cleo, a page. She's got this\nplace running like clockwork.
I find my attempts to thank her are\nalways rebuked somehow, though.
Hm. I wonder why.\nPerhaps I could try in your stead?
Is that so? I appreciate you\ncommunicating his gratitude.
He would've much rather thanked\nyou himself, you know.
The next time he speaks to you, perhaps \nyou would be so good as to not let your\nbashfulness prevent you from listening.
What gave you the idea I was feeling\nbashful?
Your ears flutter restlessly whenever you\nspeak with him.
I am merely observing the appropriate\ndeference for someone of his station.
He's not one to stand on ceremony,\nyou know.

Be that as it may, I believe it is
appropriate for a servant such as
myself to set boundaries. There is
an order to these things.
(We're at war with the Empire. My fanciful\nfeelings have no place in battle, and yet...)
Halt, troops! We rest here. Mym,\nhow long until we reach our destination?
Erm... Sorry. I'll get a map out.
(The more I try to suppress my emotions,\nthe more my heart aches.)
Oh no! We've taken a wrong turn.
Looking at the map, we should have taken\na turn at the last crossroads. I'm so sorry\nfor not realizing sooner.
We have to reach our destination by\nnightfall. We'll have to double back.\nAll forces, about face! Hurry!
Myriam. I heard of Alberius's success\ntaking down the southwestern imperial\nstronghold on your latest expedition.
Though I understand you had some\ntrouble along the way?
I made a navigational error that cost us\nsome time, but we managed to make up\nfor it.
I see. Ah, and while I have you, I wanted\nto mention—I know a promising young\nbusinessman who is looking for a wife.
In fact, I'm certain the two of you would\nget along swimmingly. Perhaps I could\narrange a meeting?

He's adopted a neutral position in the
current war, but his distribution network
could bolster your army's provisions
considerably.
You speak of a strategic marriage, then.\nOne to benefit the war effort.
You would also stand to gain much.\nA kind-hearted soul like yourself ill suits\nthe muck and mire of a battlefield.
You may endeavor to endure it for now,\nbut fatigue will eventually take its toll,\nand your strong facade will crack.
What? Perish the thought!\nI am fit for battle!

Look at what happened on your last
expedition. Can you be sure you won't
make another such mistake? Or one
greater still?
You need not wade through the trenches\nyourself to fight for peace. Surely you\ncan find a path better suited to you.
(If I continue to aid Alberius in my current\ncapacity, my feelings are bound to render\nme useless before long.)
(Perhaps it would be better to remove \nmyself from the situation, as the high\npriest suggests.)
Cleo mentioned you seemed down.\nAre you all right?
...You're a terrible liar. What troubles you?
If, hypothetically speaking, I was to resign\nfrom my post... Who would you choose as\nmy replacement?
Can't say I've ever entertained that line\nof thought. I can't imagine fighting\nwithout you by my side.
If you're truly considering it, though...\nI'd really rather you didn't.
I wouldn't be in this fight if it weren't\nfor you.
That's why I want you to fight alongside me\nto the very end. I want you to see what\nI can achieve, as the hero you made me.
Of course, this is all my ego talking.\nIf you really wanted to leave the fight,\nI would have no right to stop you.
Don't worry. I'm not going anywhere.\nIt was just a hypothetical.
Adjutant Myriam, I've finished inspecting\nthe latest shipment of supplies from our\nallies.
Very good. I'll take it from here.\nCleo, would you mind helping me\nsort the foodstuffs?
It would be my pleasure.\n...You know, you seem different, Mym.
It's like you're fully present at last.
I made up my mind to fight with him until\nthe end. I will turn the beating of my\ncaptivated heart into a source of strength.
Ignore me. Let's get down to work.
